item.title: 3b1b Lec1: The simpler quadratic formula
item.description: My notes from 3blue1brown #1 lecture. What is it? This lecture is about deriving the quadratic formula in a more intuitive matter. For those of you who don’t remember, the quadratic formula is the formula $$ r, s = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}.$$ Here $r$ and $s$ is the roots of the function $f(x) = ax^2 + bx + c$. The roots $r$ and $s$ represents where on the $x$ axis $f(x) = 0.
